__metadata.__hint_A1: This section doesn't have part in SAV file structure. Here you define custom data types and constants for later use
__metadata.__hint_A2: There are built-in types you can use for the data fields:
__metadata.__hint_A3: - int: signed int, any length, bits or bytes
__metadata.__hint_A4: - uint: usigned int, any length, bits or bytes
__metadata.__hint_A5: - coords: a pair of 1 byte uints
__metadata.__hint_A7: - bits: a sequence of bits, big endian, any length in bytes
__metadata.__hint_A8: - bit_bool: a 1 bit boolean - 1 for true, 0 for false
__metadata.__hint_terrain_5bit_type: ..W values are deprecated regular forests, same as ..F. See supplemental-info.md for details
__metadata.__hint_3122: 4 bits-sized SHORT nation type of fixed length 2
__metadata.__hint_4: general type for 3-level buildings like armory, blackmith etc
__metadata.__hint_5: general type for 2-level buildings like carpenters shop and printing press

HEADER.__hint: This is just a hint or a comment. It doesn't have effect on the SAV decoding

active_unit.__hint: index of an active unit in UNITs section, or -1 if none.

dwelling_count.__hint: tribes count, saving to meta for later use

unit_count.__hint: units count, saving to meta for later use

colony_count.__hint: colonies count, saving to meta for later use

trade_route_count.__hint: trade routes count, saving to meta for later use

backup_force.__hint: army of a power ready to help you in fight for independance

price_group_state.__hint_1: For those goods that are in a price group (rum/cigars/cloth/coats), these contain
price_group_state.__hint_2: part of the internal state used for computing their market prices, used for all nations.
price_group_state.__hint_3: See the relevant section in supplemental-info.md for more details.

rum.__hint: used as part of rum's internal price group state.

cigars.__hint: used as part of cigars' internal price group state.

cloth.__hint: used as part of cloth's internal price group state.

coats.__hint: used as part of coats' internal price group state.

event.__hint: bit flags for events shown in a 'wood box'

founded_colonies.__hint: might be used to pick next colony name

COLONY.__hint: count taken from HEAD section, see above

duration.__hint: duration of colonist's work at their jobs

tiles.__hint: each value is an index of a colonist from 'population' field working on current tile

warehouse_level.__hint: normally can be 0, 1 (for wh) or 2 (for wh exp), but can be manually set to any value

moves.__hint: 'moves' count already made. One 'move' is one move by road

origin_settlement.__hint: index of COLONY (for colonist) or DWELLING (for brave) where is he from

struct.__hint01: for pioneers, the following field may contain tools count.

profession_or_treasure_amount.__hint: Can be 'expert farmer' for ships, it's ok. A amount of gold for Treasure units (100's, i.e. 0x32 = 50d = 5000 gold)

next_founding_father.__hint: index of founding father currently in progress, or -1 if none.

royal_money.__hint: King's budget for expeditionary force expansion

struct.__hint00: these two appear to mirror each other (need to verify), though one might be for the economics advisor display and another internal.

muskets.__hint: not including muskets equipped by braves

stock.__hint: stock of each good used for trading. can be negative.

suppress.__hint: one of the bits in here is probably used to indicate that a silver resource is partially depleted (along with the suppress bit).

visitor_nation.__hint: these may be used to suppress an LCR that was visited.

unknown39b.__hint: some report that this can affect the professions that villages teach, which are likely computed (with some randomness) and not stored. RNG fix causes professions to fluctuate with each visit.

prime_resource_seed.__hint: these may contain both the prime resource and LCR seeds, possibly in nibbles.

stop_1_colony_index.__hint: corresponds to colony index in COLONY list

stop_2_colony_index.__hint: corresponds to colony index in COLONY list

stop_3_colony_index.__hint: corresponds to colony index in COLONY list

stop_4_colony_index.__hint: corresponds to colony index in COLONY list
